pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/147379

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: Merge multiple `example.js` rules into one rule instead of duplicate rules
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer; - [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed; - [X] This is not an ad/bug report. ### Problem description Hi, why the `/example.js` multiple rules are still not merged into a single rule when there are concatenation rules? Is there any reason for this? It would be good to get knowledge. For example: ```Adblock Filter List /example.js$domain=example1.com|example2.net|example3.org ``` These are a few existing examples in filter list, see:
vast.js duplicate rules

1. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/52dce3aa8e39a89fdac91ef5936e9d525d379a66/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L1667 2. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/52dce3aa8e39a89fdac91ef5936e9d525d379a66/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L3685 3. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/52dce3aa8e39a89fdac91ef5936e9d525d379a66/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L4504 4. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/52dce3aa8e39a89fdac91ef5936e9d525d379a66/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L4505 5. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/52dce3aa8e39a89fdac91ef5936e9d525d379a66/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L4508 6. comment.body:
I am concerned about the fact that the rule for the cookie bar does not work: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/95b72db3395e925f62fce4d54cd8f198dcf590b8

With devtools I made:
```adb
canva.com##body > #root ~ div[style]:not([class]):not([id]) > div[class][style] > div[class][style]:has(> div > div > div[role="dialog"] > div > span > a[href*="cookies-policy"])
canva.com##body > div[class][style]:has(~ #root) > div[class] > div[class] > div[class] > div[role="dialog"]:has(> h4[id][class] ~ div[id][class] > span > a[href*="cookies-policy"])
```

Also I made these brain fart:

```adb
canva.com##div[class]:first-child > div[class]:only-child > :is(h4, p) ~ :is(div, p) > span > a[href*="/policies/cookies-policy"]:upward(4)
```

(Failed with mobile bar - mobile now need `##div[class]:first-child:only-child > :is(h4, p) ~ :is(div, p) > span > a[href*="/policies/cookies-policy"]:upward(4)`)

comment.body:
>Error 404, Account required?

Argh, derp, that's just a brain fart. I put a placeholder link for myself to update later, then went to lunch and promptly forgot about it when I came back to hit the Submit button. I've updated the link now! ðŸ‘ Here is a video instead demonstrating the issue:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4076797/229735020-96ed649f-b091-4aaf-af51-841d56f301fd.mp4

>I suppose that it's related to this issue

Ahh yes, I didn't see that - can confirm that that exception works! `body` was a red herring, my apologies ðŸ˜„  Tested both and confirmed that `.NqU4Yg` is the problematic rule. Thanks for fixing!

Disclosure/source: I work at Canva. I didn't look deeply yet but I think that selector targets the root node for our modal / flyout layer, so it affects all kinds of dropdowns etc. I see that you've updated it now to be more specific ðŸ‘ 

Also as a side note for future cases -- at Canva we use a fairly aggressive CSS classname minifier, which is not guaranteed to be stable across builds. That means that potentially even up to once a day, classnames could change if that area of the code is modified. Apart from the fact that it's breaking other flyouts, I wouldn't trust a selector like `.NqU4Yg` to actually work as intended for more than a few weeks. If it's not too deep in the DOM, a structural / path selector instead of a specific classname would be more reliable ðŸ‘ 

Will close this one now, cheers!

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/147109

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: support.ring.com chat is broken

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

Chrome 111.0.5563.147 (Official Build) (64-bit) on Windows with uBlock 1.48.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://support.ring.com/hc/en-us/articles/360036196372-Contact-Us

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Web Annoyances Ultralist, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, I don't care about cookies, NoCoin Filter List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Visit: https://support.ring.com/hc/en-us/articles/360036196372-Contact-Us

2. Click on "Chat with Us"

3. No pop-up nothing happens.

4. This is what it looks like broken:
<details>
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12159404/229623749-e3c40eb9-e3c9-40ee-b1b9-06c4a1a0cabf.png)
</details>
And fixed:
<details>
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12159404/229624070-aa5309ee-c02a-4431-923d-4520c926e417.png)
</details> 

5. I was able to fix it with: 
`@@||cdn.solvvy.com/deflect/customization/$script,domain=support.ring.com`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
